title: Birchen Edge Walk Route

images.title: Martin Speck / Birchen Edge
images.caption: Rock climbers on Birchen Edge, near Nelson's Monument.

images.title: Colin Park / The 'Three Ships' Birchen Edge
images.caption: The 'Three Ships'. Walkers pose on top of these splendid rock formations on a clear spring day.

images.caption: Below Birchen Edge. A great winter's day.

images.title: Roger Temple / Weathered rock on Birchen Edge
images.caption: These rocks mark the southern end of the rocky cliff part of Birchen Edge which is a mecca for rock climbers.

images.title: Robin Hood Inn by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Robin Hood Inn

description: Climb to this gritstone edge and enjoy wonderful views over the Derwent Valley in the Peak District. You can start the walk from the Robin Hood pub car park just to the south of Birchen Edge. From here you can pick up the footpaths to take you across the gritstone edge to the wonderful view point where you will find Nelson's Monument. Next to this are three boulders carved with the names of three of Nelson's ships: Victory, Defiance and Royal Soverin. It's a splendid spot with interesting rock formations and fabulous views over the surrounding area. Just to the west you'll find Gardom's Edge. A public footpath runs past it towards Eagle Stone and Baslow Edge. This is a good option if you'd like to further explore this geologically fascinating area. You should see lots of rock climbers as you go. Birchen Edge is located very close to the splendid Chatsworth Park. Here you'll find 1000 acres of parkland to explore with views of the River Derwent, woodland trails and fallow deer. The Derwent Valley Heritage Way also passes nearby Baslow so you can enjoy a riverside stroll through the area. Also nearby is the spectacular Curbar Edge which has more interesting rock formations and expansive views of the Eastern Moors.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: At the start of the walk there's the Robin Hood Inn for some post walk refreshments. The family friendly pub serves good quality food and also has a free parking area and a spacious garden. They are dog friendly. Head west into Baslow village and there's The Prince of Wales to consider. The friendly pub does very good food and includes a roaring fire for winter days. In warmer weather you can relax on the Terrace garden and enjoy fine views of the surrounding hills. You can find the pub on Church Lane at a postcode of DE45 1RY for your sat navs. The inn is also dog friendly if you have your pet with you.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking head north west and visit Baslow Edge. Here you'll find another monument to one of Great Britain's historical heroes in the shape of the Wellington Monument.

display_address: B6050, Robin Hood, Baslow and Bubnell CP, Derbyshire Dales, Derbyshire, East Midlands, England, S42 7DE, United Kingdom
